We continue to develop development processes. Usually, business activity subsided in the summer to jump to the fall, but this year the summer was very busy, a lot of new products, another expansion of the development team. And the beginning of autumn showed that there is still more "boosting" to be done.Our main stack is C++ and there is one component with a lot of "legacy" that is not covered by unit tests, not even by manual tests. It‚Äôs scary to touch something every time, and it‚Äôs too expensive to rewrite. On Friday, we got together with the guys and made a strong-willed decision to impose unit tests on the code and keep the coverage metric in focus for the next six months. We chose the Catch2 framework, built it into the GitLab pipeline, we\'ll see))#CTOeveryday'], ['Yesterday I watched Professor Winston\'s amazing lecture "How to speak". Thanks for the recommendation Alena Protasova.A calm, serious, measured lecture on how to perform ‚Äúwell‚Äù. More emphasis on educational lectures, of course, but took interesting thoughts into a regular presentation. Bribed the very rhythm of the performance, giving space for reflection. I didn\'t want to speed up this one-hour lecture (although it may be due to my level of English proficiency, which did not allow me to rush).Picked up (or confirmed for myself):- ask questions at the beginning of the conversation, to study the audience;- regulate the speed of content delivery, allowing the brain to keep up with perception;- using objects from the real world for examples;- confirmed by presentation (font > 35 points, minimum words, no laser pointers);- persuading the audience through a problematic approach;- 5S model (symbol, slogan, surprise, salient idea, story) in order to promote your ideas;- spectacular end of the lecture (it was a highlight about ‚Äúdon\'t say thank you to the audience‚Äù);\xa0\xa0In general, if you are somehow connected with public speaking, if your level of English allows you to perceive from the video - Secret Super Way to Learn Anything Quickly #humor'], ['Cheburashka who is looking for friends.Yesterday, at the mentoring session, we analyzed a request for a search for a business partner. A classic case: a techie came up with "how to change the world", tried to implement it, but realized (and this is already half the way to overcome the obstacle) that he lacks competence in economics and sales.One of the experts recommended looking for a business partner. Question: how to find such a person?To begin with, I would recommend thinking about whether there is enough space for two in your business? If it\'s a boutique idea, not scalable, where you can only work as a self-employed person, then looking for a partner will not be the most effective strategy. In this case, I recommend that you first work out your attitude towards this business with a coach (why do I want to pursue this idea, what is the real reason). To understand whether the scale of implementation suits me, whether the idea itself is important to me, and what needs I cover for myself. At this moment, the understanding often comes that the point is not in the idea, but in satisfying the need for recognition, fame, etc. Determine the scale of recognition required (first guy in the village or Nobel laureate) and dig your idea again. Try to "fry" your dreams on the accelerator (fortunately there are a lot of them now), when the format of the event itself motivates you to twist your idea from different angles. By the way, at the accelerator, many startups decide that the implementation is pointless, but even more founders change the product and areas of application of their technology.See how much preparatory work needs to be done "with oneself", and we have not yet reached the partnership at all. If, after all these actions, you are still sure that you need a partner, and not a hired "salesman", only then go "on the warpath".A possible source is your environment (friends, communities). The accelerators release founders and team members who have become disillusioned with the idea and who may well strengthen your team. I observe such partnership at almost all accelerators, the main thing is not to be afraid to immediately declare this goal so that other participants know that they can join you.The very first thing you should pay attention to when evaluating a partnership opportunity is similar values. Not similar strengths and weaknesses (on the contrary, you should complement each other), namely values, your picture of the world, boundaries and attitudes. Just talk to each other, find out about hobbies, how and who spends their free time, what they like and what infuriates, etc. Treat the conversation not as an evaluation interview, but as a mutual acquaintance, not only do you "buy", but you are "buyed".Here are some simple tips, but a very difficult way... Do you have a business partner? How did it happen? ))'], ['This morning I had a mentoring session (in the morning, because the mentee is from Singapore, and this is UTC + 8) on the topic of unit analysis. An existing jewelry retailer, we calculated the possibility of scaling the business and expanding distribution channels. To evaluate the effectiveness of channels, it is necessary to divide the costs into fixed and variable, and then into direct and indirect. And the owner spent more than two weeks on such a section manually. And all because "accounting is a matter of accounting." And this is not an isolated case, when a completely successful business has absolutely no idea from what sources and how much money it receives and what this money is spent on.And at a time when startups are moving away from purely monetary metrics as much as possible towards faster indicators (funnel conversion, tracking clicks, actions, etc.), a huge layer of companies continues to work "on the principles of 30s": "bought for 1000 dollars, I sold it for 1001 dollars, and I live on this 1% "(and this is a quote from a real businessman who had a turnover of several million dollars a year, so he converted dollars into percents until he was finished in head over heels in losses). But the world is changing so fast that without accelerating, you have almost no chance of survival.But the rocket starts from a solid platform, and the car quickly accelerates only on a solid surface. So your business should rely on reliable accounting.Do you know your variable and fixed costs? And can you distribute these amounts among the best-selling product groups? Do you know what you have with profitability for specific customers? How late are you getting this information?'], ['A magical way to drastically increase conversionsDiscussing yesterday\'s post about customer segmentation, we touched upon an important point in understanding the client\'s portrait, his pains and proposed solutions. It is foolish to assume that yesterday\'s graduate and experienced specialist will buy an educational course for the same reasons. So why do we so often drive traffic from different segments to the same page?A potential client, visiting the page, should receive unambiguous and clear answers to their 5 why\'s:1. Why is this about me?2. Why is this my problem? Do I really have it?3. Why, what you suggest will solve my problem? And decide exactly?4. Why should I buy from you, why not look at others?5. Why should I buy it now and not sometime later (never)?If these answers are not available or hard to believe (for example, when they are addressed to a different audience), the chances of a deal drop sharply. But it's not like that when it comes to a big implementation.", '26'], ['Ai DataYard presents a global webinar on "The Growing Importance of People Analytics as the future of HR"

Guest Speaker: Marianna Simonian
Moderator: Ammar Jamshed
Date: 5th March 2023
Timings: 8:00 PM according to Pakistan time | 6:00 PM According to Moscow time

Join us for an insightful webinar on the Importance of People Analytics as the future of HR, featuring Marianna Simonian, a global people analytics leader with extensive experience in HR analytics. Marianna is also the head of the program "HR for startups" at the Higher School of Economics in Russia, and a country manager for tech and startups at Seed Group in Russia.

In this webinar, Marianna will share her expertise on the role of people analytics in shaping the future of HR, and why it's a crucial tool for any organization looking to stay ahead of the curve. Attendees will gain insights into the benefits of data-driven decision-making, and how to leverage analytics to optimize HR practices and drive business success.

Reach out to us at:
LMS: www.aidatayard.com
WhatsApp or Call: +92 310 0071091
Email: contact@aidatayard.com

Below, I\'ve compiled a few rules to help you with your resume writing for your dream job. So let\'s go.1. According to statistics, you have 7 seconds to catch a recruiter\'s attention, respectively, your resume should be capacious and informative, It should fit on 1 or 2 pages (3 pages are a lot).2. Format of resume - pdf only, no resume with hh. ru, no .doc or .docx. Open google sheets, write a resume, save it in pdf and send it to all recruiters.3. Photo. No photo in your resume, it takes up space, recruiters don\'t care much about how you look.4. When a recruiter takes your resume in his hands, it should be clear who you are and what position you are looking for, write it right under your first and last name, Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer or whatever. Very often you open a resume, and what a person wants isn‚Äôt clear, somewhere in the Experience section you see that a person worked as a Data Scientist (in small print), but damn it, it\'s hard to catch a recruiter\'s attention this way.5. At the top of your resume, write your contacts - phone number, github, LinkedIn, email, kaggle.6. Is your resume in English or Russian better? There is no single answer to this question. Nowadays, for most companies, it is better to make a resume in English, in extreme cases, make two versions of the resume and send the version in accordance with the company.7. Summary. The goal of a resume is to sell you first to the recruiter and then to the Data Science team. In this section, you must sell yourself. Nothing like "I will do whatever you want, just take me", remove this ‚Äúneedy‚Äù bloom (this is more for Junior\'s, of course). I am already Junior Data Scientist (no matter what), I can do this and that, I have such interests.8. Section Career / Work experience. Briefly and to the point. In the past tense. It is important what you did exactly, where were your responsibility and your contribution (not some other colleague, but yours). It is better to describe the contribution in numbers - how much money your solution earned, how much money it saved, and so on. If it‚Äôs impossible to count money impact, then write what metrics have grown. The closer the position is to the present time, the more detailed the description should be. If you have no work experience, describe the projects that you did according to the same logic.9. Skills section. Divide it into Hard-skills and Soft-skills. name: Ruslan Aydarkhanov, PhD
posts: [["I'm happy to share a great news. Our paper was not only accepted at CVPR 2023 but was also selected as an award candidate among 9000+ submissions! This is such an honor, I'm grateful to the committee for appreciating our work.If you attend the conference this June don't miss our talk. We invented an elegant continuous representation of neural networks which we call Integral Neural Networks.Here is the full list of accepted papers:https://lnkd.in/dVamG3PM #cvpr2023 #neuralnetworks", '51'], ["Surprisingly, Switzerland decided to ease the issuance of work permits for non-EU citizens a few days ago. Here's the news: https://lnkd.in/dKHYxsMbThis must be great for people like me who struggled to get past this work permit wall when applying for a job.If there are Swiss recruiters in my network who are looking for someone in machine learning or neurotech, send me a message. FYI, I hold a PhD degree from Swiss university (EPFL) which should make things even easier.I would also highly appreciate if anyone could refer me. This whole cold approach of applying through LinkedIn doesn't really work well according to career consultants (which is shameless but true). Networking is the way to go. So you could really make a difference for me.Hopefully, this new law is a game changer. Good luck to everyone who is considering Swiss job market too.", '399'], ['Hi everyone - I am looking for a new role and would appreciate your support. I consider all roles similar to ML research engineer (including neural networks, especially, their acceleration and compression) as well as any kind of neuroengineer (PhD in BCI).Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork', '47'], ['Hopefully, potential employers, who do not see much value in my PhD experience can take it as proof of my knowledge and skill.I have just completed 7 tests without preparation. According to the provided statistics, my results are above median across people with Middle positions (DS or MLE) at FAANG for most of the sections (e.g. Deep Learning, Coding, Mathematics).Not sure what is the value of this certificate but it is provided by deeplearning.ai company.#opentowork #openfornewopportunities', '37'], ['Myeong is a great scientist!', '5']]

name: Oxana Kurilina
works_at: IT Transformation Director, Enterprise Application Manager, Digital Transformation Program Delivery Executive
posts: [['View my verified achievement from IBM. Oxana is recognized by IBM for developing and cultivating a Mentoring relationship with IBM mentees as Profession Mentor,  Industry Mentor, Work/Like Integration Mentor, Customer Mentor and Navigation Mentor.', '13'], ['View my verified achievement from IBM.  Oxana is able to demonstrate understanding of the IBM Garage offering its value proposition and share it with the client for client success.', '16'], ['View my verified achievement from IBM. Oxana as Agile Explorer has understanding of Agile values, principles, and practices that allows her to initiate an Agile conversation with co-workers and colleagues.', '7'], ['View my verified achievement from IBM. Oxana has a knowledge of applying Enterprise Design Thinking and its value. —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è ))', None], ['I caught myself thinking that I broadcast posts about business so much that my main role as a CTO was in the shadows. We continue to develop development processes. Usually, business activity subsided in the summer to jump to the fall, but this year the summer was very busy, a lot of new products, another expansion of the development team. And the beginning of autumn showed that there is still more "boosting" to be done.Our main stack is C++ and there is one component with a lot of "legacy" that is not covered by unit tests, not even by manual tests. It‚Äôs scary to touch something every time, and it‚Äôs too expensive to rewrite. On Friday, we got together with the guys and made a strong-willed decision to impose unit tests on the code and keep the coverage metric in focus for the next six months. We chose the Catch2 framework, built it into the GitLab pipeline, we\'ll see))#CTOeveryday', '1'], ['Yesterday I watched Professor Winston\'s amazing lecture "How to speak". Thanks for the recommendation Alena Protasova.A calm, serious, measured lecture on how to perform ‚Äúwell‚Äù. More emphasis on educational lectures, of course, but took interesting thoughts into a regular presentation. Bribed the very rhythm of the performance, giving space for reflection. I didn\'t want to speed up this one-hour lecture (although it may be due to my level of English proficiency, which did not allow me to rush).Picked up (or confirmed for myself):- ask questions at the beginning of the conversation, to study the audience;- regulate the speed of content delivery, allowing the brain to keep up with perception;- using objects from the real world for examples;- confirmed by presentation (font > 35 points, minimum words, no laser pointers);- persuading the audience through a problematic approach;- 5S model (symbol, slogan, surprise, salient idea, story) in order to promote your ideas;- spectacular end of the lecture (it was a highlight about ‚Äúdon\'t say thank you to the audience‚Äù);\xa0\xa0In general, if you are somehow connected with public posts: [["Super excited to share üéâ that I recently had the pleasure of participating in two enriching workshops at YANDEX PRACTICUM üöÄ. The Yandex Market Hackathon üß† was a thrilling ride, providing me with my first real-world, cross-functional experience in Data Science üë©\u200düíª. Our team's spirit ü§ù was truly extraordinary, with everyone committed to helping each other.For the Yandex Market Hackathon https://lnkd.in/dxUzzEmv üì¶, our goal was to create an ML product for the Yandex Market service packer. Through collaboration, we preprocessed large volumes of raw data üíΩ, developing a Machine Learning model that efficiently estimated the best packaging methods. I took up a key role in designing a service algorithm and packer interface for the ML model üõ†Ô∏è, focusing on packaging solutions optimization. As a result, we noticed a significant improvement in packaging efficiency ‚úÖ, positively impacting Yandex Market's operational performance üìà.In another project, LinkedIn Vacancies Analysis üïµÔ∏è\u200d‚ôÇÔ∏è, I developed an automated solution to parse LinkedIn vacancies in the Data Analytics field using BeautifulSoup. The initiative aimed to provide deeper insights into market trends and job requirements üîç. Ensuring data consistency and accuracy, I transformed raw scraped data and prepared it for visualization üñ•Ô∏è. I also created an interactive dashboard https://lnkd.in/dSxCPqsi using Tableau, which helped identify key skills in demand and map out the competitive landscape in the Data Analytics job market üìä.Having tasted the thrill and impact of working in data-driven projects üí™, I am  ready to dive headfirst into new opportunities. I am actively seeking roles in Data Analysis or Data Science üéØ. With two years of analytics experience under my belt, coupled with my passion for deriving insights from data, I am ready to contribute my skills to a new team and embrace fresh challenges üåü.I'd greatly appreciate any advice or opportunities you may have to share üôè. Thank you in advance for your support! üòâ #dataanalysis #datascience #visualization #tableau #machinelearning #opportunities #job #thankyou", '1'], ['As an ambitious Data Analyst, my mission is to refine my skill set and knowledge within this exciting field üë®\u200düíª. I\'ve recently earned my diploma from the esteemed Yandex Practicum coding bootcamp, specializing in "Data Analysis" üíª. This rigorous program has been instrumental in furnishing me with a wealth of experience across a broad spectrum of areas including data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, business analytics, and cohort analysis using SQL and Python. Additionally, I\'ve honed my skills in A/B testing and visualization through Tableau. This unique blend of training has been indispensable in shaping my understanding of the analytical landscape and has provided me with the tools necessary to tackle complex data-driven problems.I was impressed by the depth and breadth of the skills üéì I\'ve developed. I learned the importance of data preprocessing, and how clean, well-structured data is the foundation of accurate analysis. I also deepened my understanding of the importance of exploratory data analysis in identifying trends and patterns, as well as the powerful insights business analytics and cohort analysis can offer. Finally, I realized that A/B testing isn\'t just about finding out what works best - it\'s about understanding why it works best, and applying these findings strategically.Upon finishing üèÅ the Yandex Practicum coding bootcamp I\'m grateful for the rigorous training I received through the Yandex Practicum and excited for the opportunities it has opened up for me. The journey of learning never stops, and I can\'t wait to take my next steps in this exhilarating field of Data Analysis.#dataanalysis #businessanalytics #python #visualization #data #tableau #sql #learning', '3'], ['I recently found out about a website ADPList, \xa0which allows people to get free mentorship to boost their professional careers. I had a great session with Younes Sandi! We talked about how to get into Data Science field and he gave me a lot of useful tips. Short session of 30 minutes was really helpful, I now have more clear understanding of the path to take. Younes is very approachable and professional. I recommend ADPList to everyone to find great mentor. #datascience #careers #people', '5'], ['My Father-in-law sent me this article from Forbes yesterday. Here is a quote from the article that was my main takeaway:"In fact, as AI becomes more accessible and mainstream, that team (analytics) may well become even more critical to the business than it already is. What is beyond doubt, though, is that their jobs will substantially change."The world is changing and we need to adapt with it. Data Analytics is undoubtedly going to change in the next 5-10 years as it adapts to new innovations.Learn the fundamentals now. Learn the new skills being created tomorrow.', '1,364'], ['If you are looking for a great book about statistics that offers a fresh approach to presenting study material and helps you freshen up your knowledge, try OpenIntro Statistics https://lnkd.in/dP-ZDsdZ.What is great about it, is that it is an excellent and free resource for anyone looking to learn about statistics. Also it has an unique approach to presenting the material. Rather than overwhelming the reader with complex formulas and technical jargon, OpenIntro Statistics breaks down concepts in a clear and concise manner, making it accessible to everyone.Another great aspect of this book is the numerous tasks and exercises at the end of each section. These exercises help solidify the concepts covered in the section and give readers a chance to practice what they have learned. I found information about OpenIntro Statistics on a post made by Nick Singh üìïüêí and recommend it too for anyone looking to learn more about statistics or freshen up their knowledge.#dataanalyst #datascientist #statistics\xa0#education', None], ['I\'m always on the lookout for new resources to help me stay sharp and prepared for interviews. That\'s why I was so excited to discover "Ace the Data Science Interview" by Nick Singh üìïüêí  and Kevin Huo, which I received recently from Amazon.This book is an incredible resource for anyone looking to break into the Data Science field or to advance their career. It\'s filled with practical tips and strategies for preparing for interviews, including how to answer common interview questions, how to showcase your technical skills, and how to stand out from the competition. What I liked most in this book is that it is full of real-world examples and exercises that will help you hone your skills and build your confidence.Overall a great book with invaluable advices. If you are currently preparing for the interviews, I highly recommend "Ace the Data Science Interview". It\'s a must-read for anyone looking to succeed in Data Science interviews.#dataanalyst #datascientist #neuralnetworks #machinelearning', '3'], ['According to the latest MIT study ChatGPT boosts productivity by 40% and quality by 20%. One of the most exciting findings from the study was that exposure to ChatGPT increased job satisfaction and self-efficacy. With the ability to enhance productivity, diminish inequality, and narrow the distribution of productivity, ChatGPT possesses the potential to bring about a revolutionary shift in the way we approach work, particularly within the realm of writing. By predominantly supplanting worker effort as opposed to simply supplementing worker skills, ChatGPT has reorganized task assignments to prioritize activities such as idea-generation and editing, while de-emphasizing the more rudimentary task of rough-drafting.How do you personally use ChatGPT? I think it really can help any professional increase their productivity, especially when you need to do a lot of drafts of text. With the help of ChatGPT, you get a first raw draft in 1 second! It‚Äôs just amazing how it works.Other use cases for me were to compare services on the web. It can create in an instant a table of all features available by 2-3 services.The last use case I would like to mention is that ChatGPT can substantially help with preparation for interviews.#productivity #writing #chatgpt #editing', '2'], ["As an aspiring Data Analyst, I am constantly striving to improve my skills and knowledge in the field üë®\u200düíª. Last year, I had the opportunity to participate in the Yandex Practicum coding bootcamp ¬´Specialist in Data Science¬ª üíª, where I gained invaluable experience in data cleaning, management, transformation, visualization, statistical and data analysis, and machine learning.Throughout the program, I learned various techniques and tools that have helped me enhance my skills and become a better Data Analyst. The hands-on projects and assignments gave me the chance to practice my skills and apply the knowledge I gained in real-world scenarios.One of the most significant takeaways from the program was learning how to handle and clean messy data. This is an essential skill for any Data Analyst, as working with raw and unorganized data can be a challenging task.The program was incredibly rigorous, but I'm grateful for the challenges it presented. By the end of the program, I felt confident in my ability to work with complex data sets and to use various tools and techniques to derive meaningful insights from them.Since completing the program, I'm excited to continue to grow and develop as a Data Analyst and currently continue my studies at Yandex Practicum ¬´Data Analytics¬ª bootcamp üòâ.#machinelearning #datascience #dataanalysis #python #bootcamp #like", '2'], ['I just finished an updated Machine Learning Specialization! Thank you Andrew Ng and DeepLearning.AI for this wonderful opportunity! I think Andrew Ng is one of the best instructors, who easily explains complex topics about ML. This is a foundational program on ML, so if you want to improve the understanding of basic AI concepts, go for it. You will get a broad introduction to: - supervised learning (linear regression, logistic regression, gradient descent),- advanced algorithms (neural networks, decision trees)- unsupervised learning (clustering, anomaly detection, PCA), recommender systems, reinforcement learning.I hope that you will have same fun, exploring this course, if you choose it too!#datascientist #dataanalyst #machinelearning #deeplearning #ai #neuralnetworks\xa0#thankyou #learning', '2']]

posts: [['–° —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞—é, —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏\xa0‚Äì Product Analyst!', '28'], ['fine weekends', '20'], ['–°–æ–±—Ä–∞–ª–∞ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã —Å —Å–æ–±–µ—Å–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ö–æ–¥–∏–ª–∞:https://lnkd.in/eeEd4CWD p.s. —Ç—É—Ç —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–∫–µ–π—Å—ã#—Å–æ–±–µ—Å–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ #–ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ #–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö', '7'], ["I haven't had a normal sleep for a week, but I have 80 thousand rubles. 1st place in True Tech Hack from MTS with my great team#hackathon #ml #mts", '33'], ['Hi everyone - I am looking for a new role and would appreciate your support. Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork', '34'], ['At this weekend I was an expert in mobile design at the App!A101 hackathon from the educational initiative Practicing Futures, Domyland and JSC "A101 DEVELOPMENT" companies About 30 schoolchildren took part in the hackathon. Their task was to propose improvements for the A101 application, according to the topics of the cases. The improvements affected both the user experience inside the application, as well as more serious and global problems. For example, the development of a community or the development of eco-culture of an apartment complex My team goal was to help the participants make a design in accordance with the brand book, prepare a prototype that will amaze the judges and help them with the value of the product they offer I haven\'t worked with schoolchildren for a very long time and I forgot how awesome it is :)Most of the participants were charged and open to try something new. Their energy and positivity is perhaps the most valuable thing that can be obtained from the participation as an expert in such eventsI think that the most important result of work of all team of organizers, experts and moderators, including me, are the questions from the participants "will there be more hackathons" and requests to notify about the start of such events in the general chat :)Thanks to the event organizers Taisia Klepova and Danny Scherbakov for a great weekend üíÉAlso thanks to the team of moderators and experts (Yuri Suprunov, Dasha Wolf, Elizaveta Voronina and others) for their support and for becoming my dream team this weekend ‚ù§Ô∏èAnd of course thanks to all the schoolchildren who took part, showed cool projects and made this wonderful event :)#hackathon #teamwork #mobileappdevelopment', '13'], ["On CyberGarden Hack we have created an event platform. The idea of our service is to unite active students and tech companies within one platform.There are a lot of hackathons being organized nowadays and it's hard for people to track all these sites separately, fill out the same questionnaires everywhere.Our solution provides people an opportunity to see all hackathons in one place, fill their portfolio once, collect achievements, send their resume to sponsor companies, create teams, and invite their friends of course.Organizers also benefit from this platform. It's easier for them to promote their events, collect information about participants. Also, they could see some intelligent data analysis using a convenient dashboard.If you are an event organizer, we will be happy to cooperate and have the opportunity to refine our platform to your needs üôÇCheck out the post, throw us an upvote and maybe a comment if you‚Äôre feeling it:", None], ['–ó–¥—Ä–∞–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–π—Ç–µ, —è –≤ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–µ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –∫–∞—Ä—å–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–π –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –±—É–¥—É –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–Ω(–∞) –∑–∞ –≤–∞—à—É –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫—É. –ó–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä—é –∑–∞ –≤—Å–µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤, —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ç—ã –∏–ª–∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å. #OpenToWork', '1']]

Drawing from my experience working with graph data at Sber and MTS over the past 7 years, I will discuss some of the key highlights from my previous presentations at\xa0MTS TrueTech Day 2023 https://lnkd.in/dyaRbe-G, PRMIA-2022 https://riskconference.ru/, DataFusion 2023 https://lnkd.in/dC_Ugf8T, and ICML-2020 https://lnkd.in/dtDdvMpE.My focus will be on both retail and corporate use cases, as well as ML models. I'm excited to meet everyone and have a productive exchange of ideas.#event #ml #fintech #banks #school #data", '23'], ['I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as Chief Data Scientist at MTS Group!', '64'], ['I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôve obtained a new certification: EF SET English Certificate 72/100 (C2 Proficient) from EF Standard English Test (EF SET) !', '19'], ['Igor Inozemtsev #Kudos I want to take a moment to say #ThankYou', '6'], ['The\xa0first step towards UK has been taken\xa0and its importance cannot be overestimated.From: home.office.atlas@notifications.service.gov.ukGOV.UKPlease find below your endorsement decision letter relating to your application for Global Talent Endorsement. name: Aleksandr Mironov
works_at: Senior Machine Learning Specialist | Data Science & Analytics Expert | Deep Learning
posts: [["A little over a year ago, I was completely amazed by the presentation of dall-e and text-to-image models in general. At that moment, the quality of the generated images was astounding; at one point, it mistakenly seemed that this was the peak of generative networks in the field of images (little did we knew haha). And now we can see how text-to-video models develop (for instance the newest Gen2 model by Runway), only a year ago we could only dream about such a result.Check this thead: https://lnkd.in/du2eQ8XBSometimes individual frames may look a little creepy, but it is already clear that in the (near?) future the generation of video by text promts will become a reality. Who knows, maybe we'll finally see a decent remake of the last season of Game of Thrones? üê≤", '5'], ['The recent success of ChatGPT has been a result of its advanced language capabilities and natural conversational style. With its ability to understand complex questions and provide accurate responses, ChatGPT has become a popular tool for a wide range of applications, from customer service to educational purposes.Many large tech companies have attempted to replicate the success of ChatGPT with their own language models, but few have been as successful. Next in line was the biggest Chinese search engine Baidu and .. it was an another stunning fail as its shares have fallen by as much as 10% after the software was unveiled.One of the reasons for the failure is said to be the total censorship of the Chinese Internet. Seems like Chinese LLMs can‚Äôt even count to 10, just look at this, it is indeed ridiculous:\xa0https://lnkd.in/dyVB4s_NOn the contrary, the relative openness of statements in the English-speaking segment of the Internet allows you to use the LLM as a mechanism for social surveys, answering questions such as "How do you feel about government actions," you only have to give the context, such as "answer as if you were a white 30-year-old man from Oregon‚Äù. In theory, the trained model will contain a context-averaged answer.But apparently the functionality of Chinese LLMs will suffer for a long time because of censorship. #LLMs #chatgpt', '6'], ['Someone might say why a data scientist should be able to deploy code in production if ml engineers exist. Well, I think there will be a shift towards more full-stack data science roles, where individuals are expected to have a wider range of skills and knowledge.Being able to work with Jupyter Notebooks is certainly good, but sometimes you need to write a large, efficient, and beautiful python code.Recently I came across a cool resource that tells how to refactor code correctly and explains complex programming concepts in a clear way. Examples of usage in different languages, including python, are given.It is definitely worth sharing, so give it a try: https://refactoring.guru/My own code has already become much better with a use of class templates and singletones #datascientist #python #pattern', '3']]

name: Olga Nikuradze
works_at: Strategic Planner at BBDO | Data Science Student at IUPUI
posts: [['This year has been nothing but challenging‚Ä¶ This fact makes me even more proud to share that I‚Äôve been promoted to Strategic Planner at BBDO! Working in advertising among great professionals is something that gives me strength to keep going and pursue my dreams. Thank you to everyone, who‚Äôs been a part of this complex, yet always rewarding journey!', '37'], ['Research has always been a fundamental part of my academic and professional careers. Nowadays most of my research is aimed at finding the common ground between the use of data in marketing and consumers‚Äô digital wellbeing & privacy. Being able to present my research at the ‚ÄúLa communication √† l‚Äô√©poque de la transformation num√©rique‚Äù conference has been a great experience. My paper ‚ÄúStrategic implications of digital targeted advertising: problems of discrimination and transparency‚Äù was aimed at exploring the main challenges targeted advertising presents both for businesses and users. Data allows us, advertising industry folks, to execute amazing campaigns. Yet it‚Äôs always important to factor consumers‚Äô wellbeing in everything we do. I believe that research in cooperation with industry professionals will help us not only become more efficient for our clients but also much fairer to the consumers! Can‚Äôt wait to expand my research on the topic and collaborate with people who share a similar vision in the coming years and beyond üìà#research #bigdata #advertising', '21'], ['Extensive experience combined with a great personality ‚Äì Pavel is an outstanding professional that any team would be lucky to have!Definitely reach out to Pavel if your business is hiring! It‚Äôd be a pity to miss out on such an asset üìà', '8'], ["It has already been 2 months since I've started my internship at BBDO Moscow. Still feels like a dream! So grateful for this opportunity to work with exciting projects and challenging tasks. Hopefully, this is just the beginning of my career path in the astonishing world of advertising üåü#BBDO #BBDOGroup #BBDOMoscow #strategicplanning #advertising", '4'], ['As 2020 is slowly approaching the end, I would like to share one great thing that happened this year. Since 2019 I and my team were slowly preparing to launch our own project. We knew that we want to help youth that is trying to make it in the creative spheres, which can seem a little scary and hard to work in (which is also true). Due to the infamous circumstances, we had to totally change the initial plans into something more accessible. And that is how ‚Äúdiapazon‚Äù was born.‚ÄúDiapazon‚Äù (directly translated from Russian as ‚Äúrange‚Äù) is a functional platform aimed at gathering support for young creative people. Our main goal is to help young creators to overcome barriers on their ways to becoming a creator. We aim to help those who are socially unprotected, facing way more obstacles in their ways.In 7 months we managed to:‚Äî help 5 youth creators to implement their creative projects ‚Äî host 2 competitions with our partner organizations (involving over 100 participants and resulting in job offers)‚Äî gain over 700 supporters on SNS Something we‚Äôre also greatly proud of is being mentioned in an article about creative hubs in the Forbes Russia article! A dream come true. We have recently launched the English version of our website, so feel free to visit - en.diapazonzip.com :)', '5'], ['A few days ago I was given the honor to present at the opening of the All-Russian inclusive competition for students with disabilities ‚ÄúProfessional tomorrow‚Äù alongside the representative of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation. As a past winner of that competition, I was more than excited to present in front of other students and organizers! For the past 2 years, I have been an active participant & one of the organizers of our university‚Äôs ‚ÄúResource Training and Methodological Center for the training of persons with disabilities‚Äù. Inclusive education has definitely been one of the Russian universities‚Äô main priorities for the past years. It is extremely exciting to see students with disabilities from over the country (115 cities!) become engaged in activities and connect, creating a powerful network. Can not wait to see what the future brings for all of us! #inclusiveeducation #inclusionmatters', '7'], ['Mina Liang and the ReneCycle, Inc. team doing some outstanding work! Make sure to check them out! The future of bikesharing üôå', '2'], ['So excited to announce that I was chosen as one of the 100 youth representatives (coming from all over Russia) to participate in the leadership program aimed at connecting the best graduates of the All-Russian Forum Campaign 2020. 2020 has been as challenging as it could be, yet it was also flourishing with various opportunities. This year I managed to take part in 4 international and all-Russian forums, meeting hundreds of the most ambitious and goal-oriented students & young professionals. The forum campaign also gave me the chance to explore parts of Russia I‚Äôve never been to - learning more about the many ethnicities and cultures that are a part of our country. In the coming months all of the participants, including me, are going to go through an extensive leadership training course that will encourage us to shape the society we want to live in!More than thrilled to be a part of this program üåü', '17'], ['Throughout the last week, I was honored to attend the 46th International Conference (IC) organized by Business Today and Princeton University. #IC2020 brought together some of the most talented students from all over the world (220 students from over 60 countries) with top executives and business leaders. During the conference, we explored how business leaders have integrated social responsibility into their companies and championed a society open to diversity and sustainability. Coming from a very socially oriented professional background, I can not explain how valuable and insightful all of the panels and executive seminars have been for me. It was also delightful to meet fellow attendees! So many bright minds from all over the globe. Our future is in wonderful hands! I would also like to thank every person of the amazing IC Team, who have made this conference possible despite the unprecedented challenges 2020 has brought upon all of us. Beyond thankful for the opportunity to be a part of such an inspiring experience!#businesstoday #internationalconference #IC', '21'], ['Open Source Leader 2020 complete!', None]]

—Å–≥–µ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –≤ DALLE2\xa0#chatgpt #analytics', '26'], ['Let\'s talk about meetups and how to prepare for them! This post will be useful for those who are also thinking about speaking at meetups. And if you\'ve already given a presentation or have something to share, feel free to add your comments! ‚ñ´Ô∏èHow did the idea for a meetup come about? - I\'ve been thinking about semi-professional blogging, writing articles, and speaking at meetups for a long time. It all has positive consequences. For example, when applying for an O1 visa in the USA or Global Talent in the UK.\xa0- Speaking at a famous conference is only possible with a strong presentation. That is a significant change in the product, something deeply technical, and so on. It requires a lot of preparation.\xa0- I knew I was going on a business trip to Moldova in January. I had heard that there were regular meetups in Chisinau. And I also knew that the general level of product in the country was somewhat lower than in the top European companies. All these points came together - the idea was to create a meetup that would immerse the audience in analytics without overloading them with technical details.‚ñ´Ô∏èWhat was the topic of the meetup and why?I decided that the meetup would consist of two parts - a basic report "Product analytics - where to start?" and a workshop on metrics, A/B testing, and product cases.\xa0- Why not tell companies in Moldova how to build analytics and what it can do for them? Here I wanted to give some thoughts on how to implement analytics in a company.\xa0- The second part of the meetup is a bit more complicated - there were ideas to talk about some of our product cases, but then I would have to do it myself. Two reports in a row from one speaker could be boring, so I decided to hold a workshop with my analyst colleague. During the workshop, we planned to divide the audience into several groups and let them solve small product analysis cases for 5-10 minutes each.\xa0\xa0‚ñ´Ô∏èHow did I prepare for the meetup? - Public speaking lessonsAt the beginning of 2022, I took some classes in rhetoric and public speaking, learned to breathe properly, speak clearly, etc.\xa0Now I decided to take some more lessons to rehearse the presentation. We discussed how to present the information, what to emphasize, and when to pause. In general, there was a necessary foundation. - Training with a mentorIt is necessary to give only verified information in order not to mislead people, right?\xa0To make sure the information is correct throughout the meeting, I called my mentor. He can point out mistakes, advise on something more complete or even bring in new ideas. Also, when there is no opportunity to give a presentation in a company or elsewhere, such advice is very useful. ‚ñ´Ô∏èWhat this meetup will do:- Develop my personal brand\xa0- Increase my company\'s brand awareness- The first public speaking experience for me and my colleagueDo you have any experience in public speaking?', '30'], ["Last week I was delighted to initiate and speak at a Product Analytics Meetup and Workshop in Moldova!I'll tell you more about the preparations soon :)", '4'], ["Decided it was time to share my experience with my younger colleagues! I‚Äôll be a mentor in the next Women In Tech program (https://women-in-tech.org). Applied about a month ago, and recently found out I passed! üí´The program takes place approximately every 6 months. You can become either a mentee or a mentor, but in both cases you need to be pre-screened. Both men and women can be mentors, however, only women can be mentees. All in all, I'm looking forward to meeting my mentees!", '31']]

We track that people analytics, or HR-analytics, is about HR + analytics. But it's not like that when it comes to a big implementation.", '26'], ['Ai DataYard presents a global webinar on "The Growing Importance of People Analytics as the future of HR"

Guest Speaker: Marianna Simonian
Moderator: Ammar Jamshed
Date: 5th March 2023
Timings: 8:00 PM according to Pakistan time | 6:00 PM According to Moscow time

Join us for an insightful webinar on the Importance of People Analytics as the future of HR, featuring Marianna Simonian, a global people analytics leader with extensive experience in HR analytics. Marianna is also the head of the program "HR for startups" at the Higher School of Economics in Russia, and a country manager for tech and startups at Seed Group in Russia.

In this webinar, Marianna will share her expertise on the role of people analytics in shaping the future of HR, and why it's a crucial tool for any organization looking to stay ahead of the curve. Attendees will gain insights into the benefits of data-driven decision-making, and how to leverage analytics to optimize HR practices and drive business success.

Reach out to us at:
LMS: www.aidatayard.com
WhatsApp or Call: +92 310 0071091
Email: contact@aidatayard.com

posts: [['–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! –û–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏—â—É –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω—ã—Ö senior (–µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ middle –≤–∞–∫–∞–Ω—Å–∏–∏) –Ω–∞ 2 –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–∏ : 1) Data Engineer –∏ 2) —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç —Å –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º –≤ ML Engineering/MLOps/DevOps –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—â—É—é –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç (–ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ) –°–±–µ—Ä–∞. –ü—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å–æ–±–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–º–æ—â–Ω–∏–∫–∞ —Å –º–Ω–æ–∂–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö ML/AI –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π. –§—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä—É—é—â–∏–π MVP –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è (–Ω–∞ iOS) —É–∂–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å, —Å–µ–π—á–∞—Å –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º—Å—è –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥–∞ MVP –∫ —Ü–µ–ª–µ–≤–æ–º—É –≤–∏–¥—É. MLEngineer/MLOps –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏: —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∏ microservices solution –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –¥–ª—è ML/AI —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ —Å —É—á–µ—Ç–æ–º —Ç–µ—Ö.—Å—Ç–µ–∫–∞; ML System Design. –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–º –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –æ–ø—ã—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ –°–±–µ—Ä–µ (–≤ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å–æ —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–æ–π –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ–≥–æ —Ç–µ—Ö. —Å—Ç–µ–∫–∞).–¢–µ—Ö. –°—Ç–µ–∫ –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ–º—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è: Linux, Docker, OpenShift, Nexus, Jenkins, Git, PostgreSQL, Greenplum, Airflow, Informatica, Python, –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã noSQL-—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, ClickHouse.DE –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏:–†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–æ–≤ –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–∑ –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤; —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–≤ –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –≤ –ë–î(PL/PostgreSQL), –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–π –º–µ–∂–¥—É –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º–∏; –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–∞ –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–µ–≥–æ –º–æ–Ω–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö.–¢–µ—Ö. –°—Ç–µ–∫ –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ–º—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è: Linux, Git, PostgreSQL, Greenplum, Python, –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ ETL/ELT + ETL-–∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã: Airflow, Informatica; –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã noSQL-—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, ClickHouse; –æ–ø—ã—Ç –≤ Data Quality.–†–µ–∂–∏–º —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥–Ω—ã–π (–æ—Ñ–∏—Å+—É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∫–∞). –ö–æ–Ω—Ç–∞–∫—Ç: –í–∏–∫–∞ –î–æ—á–∫–∏–Ω–∞, telegram @victoria_dochkina', '18'], ['On March 6, me and my colleague Lavrentiy Grigoryan\xa0will speak on the topic of "Testing Machine Learning Systems‚Äù at the open conference on artificial intelligence OpenTalks.AI.Today we published a post on this topic\xa0on Medium: https://lnkd.in/g5GA5MzpWill be glad to hear thoughts and opinions on this topic in the comments to the article.', '10']]

name: Vadim Kulikov

name: Ruslan Aydarkhanov, PhD
posts: [["I'm happy to share a great news. Our paper was not only accepted at CVPR 2023 but was also selected as an award candidate among 9000+ submissions! This is such an honor, I'm grateful to the committee for appreciating our work.If you attend the conference this June don't miss our talk. We invented an elegant continuous representation of neural networks which we call Integral Neural Networks.Here is the full list of accepted papers:https://lnkd.in/dVamG3PM #cvpr2023 #neuralnetworks", '51'], ["Surprisingly, Switzerland decided to ease the issuance of work permits for non-EU citizens a few days ago. Here's the news: https://lnkd.in/dKHYxsMbThis must be great for people like me who struggled to get past this work permit wall when applying for a job.If there are Swiss recruiters in my network who are looking for someone in machine learning or neurotech, send me a message. FYI, I hold a PhD degree from Swiss university (EPFL) which should make things even easier.I would also highly appreciate if anyone could refer me. This whole cold approach of applying through LinkedIn doesn't really work well according to career consultants (which is shameless but true). Networking is the way to go. So you could really make a difference for me.Hopefully, this new law is a game changer. Good luck to everyone who is considering Swiss job market too.", '399'], ['Hi everyone - I am looking for a new role and would appreciate your support. I consider all roles similar to ML research engineer (including neural networks, especially, their acceleration and compression) as well as any kind of neuroengineer (PhD in BCI).Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork', '47'], ['Hopefully, potential employers, who do not see much value in my PhD experience can take it as proof of my knowledge and skill.I have just completed 7 tests without preparation. According to the provided statistics, my results are above median across people with Middle positions (DS or MLE) at FAANG for most of the sections (e.g. Deep Learning, Coding, Mathematics).Not sure what is the value of this certificate but it is provided by deeplearning.ai company.#opentowork #openfornewopportunities', '37'], ['Myeong is a great scientist!', '5']]

name: Alena Bondarchuk
works_at: Head of Operations | Project director | 15+ of experience in process optimization
posts: [["We're a startup helping moms and dads in maternity/paternity leave find jobs.We're testing our hypotheses with USA IT companies, starting with QA specialists.Moms looking for a job can contact us if they've worked as QA or want to join the IT industry. We're also seeking HR/recruiters to help us connect with IT companies.DM for more info.#maternityleave #paternityleave #QA #jobopportunities #recruiters", '8'], ["tl;dr: C++ Lead, $15-18k+/month + annual bonus ~doubling the salary, relocation to Dubai üèùOrder Capital, an HFT fund founded by an ICPC champion, is looking for a rockstar C++ lead ü¶ÑA great opportunity for those who have reached their ceiling in, say, FAANG and are ready for new challenges: you will have a team to lead, your own product to work on, loads of architectural tasks, but also plenty of room to write some code yourself. Plus, you'll be surrounded by IMO/IOI winners ‚Äî isn't that cool?Dream candidate:‚Äî knows C++ really well and keeps an eye on changes to the standard;‚Äî is super savvy with back-end;‚Äî has been leading tech teams for 2+ years (3+ is even better!);‚Äî has a competitive programming/math background;‚Äî is familiar with high performance systems or ready to quickly get the hang of them.The office is located in Dubai, and the salary range is $15-18k+/month. With bonuses it'll be twice as much (and maybe more)! üíéA caring relocation package for you and your family, super cool corporate parties (we are speaking from experience!), and heaps of other nice perks ‚Äî like medical insurance that covers dentistry or taxi reimbursement during the hot season. Your CVs and questions are very welcome here: Alina Shorokhova", '10'], ['Hi everyone - I am looking for a new role and would appreciate your support. Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork #OperationsDirector #ProjectDirector #pmo #COO #DeputyCEO', '25'], ['Edburo has decided to look for an investor. It is time to step out of the shadows and turn to the full in what drives and changes approaches to corporate training.Today our ed-tech agency Edburo is a profitable operating business. We operate as an outsourced training department. We set up training for clients and employees on the products and processes of companies and prepare all educational content and its packaging on educational platforms. We have Aliexpress, Travelpayouts (Aviasales), BAT (British American Tobacco), and many others in the portfolio.For a year and a half of work, we have perfected the business model and set up automated processes within the company. We have worked out various cases from various market segments. All important metrics were calculated. We formed the brand philosophy, and our attitude to our project and determined the path to where and why we are going.The next step is to increase by 7 times by 2026. There are all prerequisites for this. We have strategy, team, understanding of bottlenecks and strengths. There is a developing market as well (online corporate training will only grow).Now what we need are working hands and promotions. There is a lot of desire to change the attitude towards corporate training not as ‚Äúa black hole in the budget‚Äù, but as a full-fledged business growth driver.In general, we would be grateful for your recommendations of us and your suggestions of people who may be interested in corporate Ed-tech highly attached to HR-tech. All presentations and documents are ready and waiting for us to send them to those who will believe in our company as much as we do üôÇYou can write either here, in telegram @kharitonova_ns, or by on football analytics, I have listen to a lot of podcasts and read articles on a football topic.I decided to share here the thoughts that arise in the learning process.- If you are just implementing video analytics in a club, you should immediately think about developing a Video Banking system.- Video The bank should store detailed cuts of its players in different sections (corners, outs, positional attacks, counterattacks, and so on)- Optionally store cuts of opponents in the Video BankAnd then, as a computer vision engineer, it seemed to me that it would be a good idea to collect all the cuts and train the action recognition model. This would reduce the work time of the club's video analyst in the future. Although I'm sure they already do this =)#soccer #football #learning #computervision", '35'], ['–°—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–ª—Å—è –æ—Ç–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —Ç–æ–ø–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Å–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä–æ–≤.–£–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–æ—Å—å', '52'], ['#library #codeTorch-Pruning - Pruning models for data collectionTorch-Pruning is a structural network pruning library that supports a wide variety of neural networks such as Vision Transformers, ResNet, DenseNet, RegNet, ResNext, FCN, DeepLab, VGG, etc. SeePruning or pruning is a popular approach to the high computational cost of neural networks by removing redundancy.Installation:git clone https://lnkd.in/eXt9Zv48', '10'], ['#library #codeType annotation for tensorsFarewell, bugs! Therefore, the demos of my projects are moving to Streamlit  clouds. Screening Mammography Breast Cancer Detection.The goal is to detect breast cancer. You train the model using a breast harvest that you collect as a result of observing the screening.Your work to improve breast cancer case detection can help radiologists be more accurate and efficient, and improve the quality and safety of patient care. It can also help cut costs and unnecessary medical procedures.The dataset is a dicom image of the breast, and patient metadata is also provided.And then I decided to shake up my medical antiquity and make a small notebook with EDA + image crop + albumentations augs examples.Link: https://lnkd.in/eU-4NG5sPSIf you have an account on kaggle, then upvote is welcome =)', '34'], ['MLOps for Batch Scoring with Airflow, DVC and MLEM–ó–∞–ø–∏—Å—å –æ—Ñ—Ñ–ª–∞–π–Ω —Å–µ–º–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–∞, –ª—é–±–µ–∑–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ Beeline Kazakhstan, –æ—Ç —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ Iterative, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—â–µ–π —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ MLOps —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–æ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–π DVC.\xa0 –°–ø–∏–∫–µ—Ä—ã:- Guschin Alexander- Mikhail Rozhkov–ü–ª–∞–Ω —Å–µ–º–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–∞:‚Ä¢\xa0MLOps workflow and tools for Batch Scoring projects\xa0‚Ä¢\xa0DVC –¥–ª—è –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ ML —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤\xa0‚Ä¢\xa0–î–µ–ø–ª–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π —Å MLEM‚Ä¢\xa0–ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä end-to-end pipeline: Airflow + DVC + MLEM + MLflow/Studioyoutu.be/cxQCIPspMkA', '22']]

name: Jalal Rahmanov
posts: [["üéâ Nobody is perfect but a team can be üéâüì¢ I am thrilled to share that QSS Analytics, under the exceptional leadership of Etibar H√ºseynli, had the incredible opportunity to organize a highly successful #DataScienceWorkshop! üöÄ As the proud organizers, we brought together an impressive lineup of senior data scientists and startups from various leading companies in #Azerbaijan .üë• I am incredibly grateful to be part of a remarkable team that orchestrated this event flawlessly. Together, we showcased the power of collaboration and teamwork in organizing an insightful and impactful workshop. üëèüìä This event was a true celebration of knowledge sharing and collaboration within the data science community. We witnessed thought-provoking discussions on cutting-edge technologies, emerging trends, and valuable insights into bridging the gaps in the field of data. üìàü§ù It was truly inspiring to see the top experts in Azerbaijan's data industry converge under one roof, exchanging experiences and ideas, fostering innovation, and collectively shaping the future of data science. üåüüîç The workshop covered a wide range of topics, including the legal aspects of data use and the crucial relationship between data experts and management. These discussions highlighted the importance of ethical data practices and effective communication between technical teams and decision-makers. üí°üåü A special thanks to all the participants, speakers, and attendees who made this workshop an unforgettable experience! Your enthusiasm and dedication to data science made this event truly extraordinary. üôå#QSSAnalytics #DataScienceWorkshop #DataScienceAcademy #DataScienceCommunity #Azerbaijan #DataExperts #DataScience #KnowledgeSharing #Collaboration #Innovation #Teamwork #CommunityBuilding #EthicalDataPractices #FutureOfDataScience #ExcitingTimes", '85'], ['I am happy to share that I have been accepted as a Core Member of the Global AI Hub.Thanks to Aysel Jafarzade for sharing a post about Global Aƒ∞ Hub registration details.', '94']]

name: Zarifa Mammadli
posts: [['At our Data Science Workshop on May 14th at the Holiday Inn Hotel, 8 experts discussed the key points and latest trends on effective management of AI and Data Science practices in enterprises, along with years of experience.Our event covered important topics such as creating a data and artificial intelligence strategy, data technologies and infrastructure strategy, implementing basic solutions for companies, government agencies and other organizations, data rights, security, GDPR and ethical issues.As a member of the team of Data Science Lab, a partner of QSS Analytics, within the framework of the event, I got detailed information about the latest trends and technologies in the world of Data Science, new algorithms and articles used to solve problems related to them. It was very valuable to get together with colleagues who shared their views on this topic, as well as to gain new perspectives on the development of our company.I am deeply grateful to Etibar H√ºseynli  and other partners, including  QSS Analytics , for creating this opportunity for me. I will look for new ways to improve the user experience and increase interactivity by applying the information I get to our projects in our company. I am honored to be a member of the QSS Analytics family!', '59']]

posts: [["Google has created a Generative AI learning path with 9 FREE courses!Topics cover:- Intro to LLMs- Attention Mechanism- Image Generation/Captioning- Intro to Responsible AIFrom the fundamentals of LLMs to creating & deploying generative AI solutions! üöÄRead more üßµüëá  1Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction to Generative AI:An introductory level micro-learning course aimed at explaining:- What Generative AI is - How it is used - How it differs from traditional MLCheck this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/duKJ3sm62Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction to Large Language Models:The course explores:- Fundamentals LLMs- Their use cases- Prompt engineering on LLMsCheck this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dm_yS4MQ3Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction to Responsible AI:The course explains what responsible AI is, why it's important, and how Google implements responsible AI in their products.Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dV8zNvwm4Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction to Image Generation:This course introduces diffusion models, a family of ML models that recently showed promise in the image generation space.Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dqcZBZqd5Ô∏è‚É£ Encoder-Decoder Architecture:This course gives you a synopsis of the encoder-decoder architecture.It's a powerful and prevalent machine learning architecture for sequence-to-sequence tasks.Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dhDhUgwJ6Ô∏è‚É£ Attention Mechanism:The course teaches you how attention works & how it revolutionised:- machine translation - text summarisation- question answeringCheck this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dwsZZw6j7Ô∏è‚É£ Transformer Models and BERT Model:This course introduces you to some of the most famous and effective transformer architectures!Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dK4p3n2s8Ô∏è‚É£ Create Image Captioning Models:This course teaches you how to create an image captioning model by using deep learning.Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/d8w32x5Y9Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction to Generative AI Studio:This course introduces Generative AI Studio, a product on Vertex AI.It teaches you to prototype and customize generative AI models so you can use their capabilities in your applications.Check this outüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dAXdSrEXThat's a wrap!If you interested in:- Python üêç- AI/ML ü§ñ- Maths for ML üßÆ- MLOps üõ†- CV/NLP üó£- LLMs üß†Find me ‚Üí\xa0https://lnkd.in/em_V4unu\xa0‚úîÔ∏èEveryday, I share tutorials on above topics!Check my tutorial on Self-attentionüëáhttps://lnkd.in/dwVjZXKU", '18,399'], ["üì¢ I am thrilled to share that QSS Analytics  Analytics, under the exceptional leadership of Etibar H√ºseynli, had the incredible opportunity to organize a highly successful #DataScienceWorkshop! As the proud organizers, we brought together an impressive lineup of senior data scientists and startups from various leading companies in #Azerbaijan.üë• I am incredibly grateful to be part of a remarkable team that orchestrated this event flawlessly. Together, we showcased the power of collaboration and teamwork in organizing an insightful and impactful workshop.ü§ùüèÜ This event was a true celebration of knowledge sharing and collaboration within the data science community. We witnessed thought-provoking discussions on cutting-edge technologies, emerging trends, and valuable insights into bridging the gaps in the field of data.üìàüìä It was truly inspiring to see the top experts in Azerbaijan's data industry converge under one roof, exchanging experiences and ideas, fostering innovation, and collectively shaping the future of data science.üí´ #datascience #data #team", '42'], ['üéØ Complex SQL Queries üöÄSQL or Structured Query Language is basically the language that we (the user) use to communicate with the Databases and get our required interpretation of data out of it. It is used for storing, manipulating and retrieving data out of a database.üëâ Here is a guide to learn and practice Complex SQL QueriesProfessional roles that require SQL skills include the following:üë®\u200düíª Data Scientistüë©\u200düíª Data Analystüë®\u200düíª Data Engineerüë©\u200düíª Business Intelligence AnalystCredits:\xa0Unknown#sql\xa0#data\xa0#datascience\xa0#dataengineering\xa0#datascientist\xa0#businessintelligence\xa0#dataanalytics\xa0#programming #database', '2,230'], ["Thrilled to announce: 3 new Generative AI courses! Check them out here: https://lnkd.in/gQdegxe2I. Building Systems with the ChatGPT API, taught by OpenAI's Isa Fulford and me: Go beyond individual prompts, and learn to build complex applications that use multiple API calls to an LLM. Also learn to evaluate an LLM's outputs for safety and accuracy, and drive iterative improvements. https://lnkd.in/gaJ7krqxII. LangChain for LLM Application Development, taught by LangChain's CEO Harrison Chase and me: Learn this powerful open-source tool for building applications using LLMs, including memory for chatbots, Question answering over a doc, and an LLM agent that can decide\xa0what action to take next. https://lnkd.in/gzzDqTDrIII. How Diffusion Models Work, taught by Lamini's CEO Sharon Zhou: Learn the technical details of how diffusion models - which power Midjourney, DALL¬∑E, and Stable Diffusion - works. You‚Äôll also end up with working code to generate your own video game sprites in a Jupyter notebook! https://lnkd.in/gBqUKuwV.All of these courses are free for a limited time, and each can be completed in around 1-1.5 hours. I hope you enjoy them. Also, please help me spread the word and encourage others to sign up too!", '23,294'], ['Use #chatgpt to prepare a PowerPoint Presentation:Prompt:‚ÄúI want you to write me VBA code for a PowerPoint presentation about the history of AI. You are to fill in all the text with your own knowledge, no placeholders. I need 5 slides.‚Äù', '80,373'], ['Are you looking for a hands-on resource for learning computer vision modeling?Lock yourself in a room and spend some time with this repo üëáIt contains dozens of Computer Vision tutorials focusing on different applications of YOLO models for objects detections and classifications using Python and PyTorch.- Video tutorials:\xa0https://lnkd.in/gKgGRQVP- Github: https://lnkd.in/ej_542MC‚Äî‚úîÔ∏è I share daily content about AI and how to turn data into growth and business impact. Don\'t forget to click "Follow" on my profile!', '15'], ['Dear Connections,As of today, I am happy to be a Certified "Microsoft Office Specialist" by Microsoft. Thanks for supporting me in this way Allahveran Haciyev (MCT, MCSA , DAA)  and UpData.az. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------D…ôy…ôrli Baƒülantƒ±larƒ±m,Bu g√ºn, q√ºrur v…ô sevinc hissi il…ô bildirm…ôk ist…ôyir…ômki artƒ±q r…ôsmi olara Microsoftun  "Microsoft Office Specialist" sertifikatƒ±na sahib…ôm. Bu yolda m…ôn…ô d…ôst…ôk olduƒüu √º√ß√ºn m√º…ôllimim Allahveran Haciyev (MCT, MCSA , DAA) v…ô UpData.az  ail…ôsin…ô √∂z minn…ôtdarlƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ± bildirir…ôm.', '17'], ['I never use Linear Regression! I am not saying you shouldn‚Äôt, I personally never do. Actually there are many algorithms I never use: Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, SVM, LDA, KNN, Feed Forward Neural Networks,... I just don‚Äôt find value in those for my work.For me the simplest model to use as a starting point for a model development is XGBoost (this includes LightGBM or Catboost as similar models). Well at least for tabular data! XGBoost natively handles missing values, categorical variables (to some extent!), it is parallelizable (so fast‚Ä¶enough), it trains on any loss function I may need, it tends to be robust to overfitting on a large number of features, and it is highly non-linear which makes it a very low bias algorithm. Its API is pretty complete, and you can achieve a lot by changing a couple of arguments. For years, I have used the same set of hyperparameters that work very well from one data set to another. I can easily throw any data into XGBoost with very little effort and this gives me a useful baseline that can drive my development from there.Here are a couple of resources to dig deeper:Github repos:- Gradient Boosting Research Papers: A curated list of gradient boosting papers with implementations: https://lnkd.in/gZQez7MG- AutoXGB: auto train XGBoost directly from CSV files, auto tune XGBoost using optuna, auto serve best XGBoost model using fastAPI: https://lnkd.in/gXPENn9s- xgboostExplainer: An R package that makes XGBoost models fully interpretable: https://lnkd.in/gUi7WJFR- XGBoostLSS: An extension of XGBoost for probabilistic forecasting: https://lnkd.in/gk8BP3ZY- Data-Science-Competitions: The goal of this repo is to provide the solutions to all Data Science Competitions (Kaggle, Data Hack, Machine Hack, Driven Data etc...): https://lnkd.in/ge9Hfpz5Similar models:- LightGBM: LightGBM is a gradient boosting framework that uses tree-based learning algorithms. It is designed to be distributed and efficient: https://lnkd.in/gpHwb6N9\xa0- CatBoost: CatBoost is an algorithm for gradient boosting on decision trees. It reduces parameter tuning time, because CatBoost provides great results with default parameters. It allows you to use non-numeric factors out of the box, so no need for pre-processing: https://catboost.ai/- H20.ai‚Äôs GBM: H2O‚Äôs GBM sequentially builds regression trees on all the features of the dataset in a fully distributed way: https://lnkd.in/gC-B4Sy5Youtube videos:- XGBoost series by StatQuest: https://lnkd.in/gNVZuhfS- XGBoost in Python from Start to Finish by StatQuest: https://lnkd.in/gSYCNYj3- XGBoost Made Easy: https://lnkd.in/gqhT9_jR- XGBoost: How it works, with an example: https://lnkd.in/grwWQEDk- How to train XGBoost models in Python: https://lnkd.in/gzmyvy2GAlso checkout Why XGBoost is better than GBM: https://lnkd.in/gib74v9v----Receive a Free Machine Learning PDF when subscribing to our newsletter: TheAiEdge.io#machinelearning #datascience #artificialintelligence', '2,849'], ['Python for Machine Learning: Real-World Projects and Case StudiesPlease reshare to your #LinkedIn network so everyone can take advantage of these resources!‚úÖVisit Shivam Modi (22k Followers) and learn complete Data Science and Analytics from scratch through my old posts.üí°Checkout #datascience blogs and other FREE resources on my website: https://lnkd.in/d-xyvmAC#datascience #datascientist #machinelearning #data #dataanalytic', '220'], ["ùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ ùó∂ùòÄ ùóØùó≤ùòÅùòÅùó≤ùóø, ùóÆùó∞ùó∞ùòÇùóøùóÆùó∞ùòÜ ùóºùóø ùóôùü≠-ùòÄùó∞ùóºùóøùó≤?If you ask around, everyone will tell you that F1 is better when the dataset is unbalanced (so basically always). If you then ask for more details, they will probably give you some vague explanations revolving around the different costs that these metrics attribute to errors (False Positives and False Negatives). But what are ùó≤ùòÖùóÆùó∞ùòÅùóπùòÜ these costs?In my latest Towards Data Science article, I delved into this topic and showed how these metrics can be decomposed (or approximated, in the case of the F1-score) as the product of each element of the confusion matrix with its value (or cost).Moreover, following this approach, it is possible to easily define your own metric, depending on how much each correct (wrong) prediction is worth (costs). Indeed, if you define a (possibly economic) value for each quantity (True Positives, False Positives, True Negatives, and False Negatives), then ùòÜùóºùòÇùóø ùó∫ùó≤ùòÅùóøùó∂ùó∞ ùòÑùó∂ùóπùóπ ùóøùó≤ùóΩùóøùó≤ùòÄùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùó≤ùòÖùóΩùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùó≤ùó± (ùó≤ùó∞ùóºùóªùóºùó∫ùó∂ùó∞) ùòÉùóÆùóπùòÇùó≤ ùóºùó≥ ùòÜùóºùòÇùóø ùó∞ùóπùóÆùòÄùòÄùó∂ùó≥ùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª.In this way, you can ùó±ùó∂ùóøùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùóπùòÜ ùó∫ùóÆùòÖùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòáùó≤ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùòÉùóÆùóπùòÇùó≤ ùóØùóøùóºùòÇùó¥ùóµùòÅ ùóØùòÜ ùòÜùóºùòÇùóø ùó∫ùóºùó±ùó≤ùóπ (rather than an uninterpretable metric as F1). In the image below, you can see an example of how the optimal number of observations predicted as positives changes depending on the value attached to TP, FP, TN, and FN. This custom metric has a ùó±ùó∂ùóøùó≤ùó∞ùòÅ ùó≤ùó∞ùóºùóªùóºùó∫ùó∂ùó∞ ùó∂ùóªùòÅùó≤ùóøùóΩùóøùó≤ùòÅùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª, so it's much better for taking business decisions. And, needless to say, it is far more understandable for business stakeholders than some exotic quantities such as F1-score.üìô Read my full article on Towards Data Science: https://lnkd.in/eaeUHr6Y#datascience #statistics #machinelearning #metrics #accuracy #f1score #classification #confusionmatrix #dataforbusiness #datadriven", '219']]

posts: [['Real-time Feelings Detection & Emotion recognition using AI!Real-time feelings detection and emotion recognition using AI is an area of research that uses machine learning algorithms to analyze facial expressions, speech patterns, and other physiological signals to detect and analyze human emotions in real time. works_at: Production Technician Trainee | Production & Operations | bp
posts: [["I've successfully completed 5-day OPITO approved Offshore Emergency Response Team Member (OERTM) course to perform my new role effectively on the site. Thanks Occupational Training International and instructors for arranging such a informative course with full of practical exercises. #training #offshore #OPITO", '76'], ['Happy 11th year, BHOS family! #BANM #BHOS', '10'], ["Last Friday was my last day with SOCAR NQT. It was an exciting journey, full of learning for more than 1 year. Thank you for the continued support Anar Huseynov, PMP¬Æ, Natiq Aliyev, Mahammad Shukurlu and the rest of the Project Management team.  Today, I‚Äôm joining the bp family and contributing to Production & Operations team as Production Technician Trainee. I can't wait to grow and learn in this new chapter of my life! It wouldn't have been possible without the support of my colleagues, relatives and friends.#bp #oilandgas #production", '256'], ['Happy 10 years, Baku Higher Oil School! üá¶üáøI‚Äôm proud to be a part of this family! üéì#BHOS #BANM #10years', '42'], ['#Oilplatform #Construction #Challenges Although power supply of most oil platforms is fulfilled by diesel generators, Shell has designed its Appomattox oil platform fully electric by driving idea from Tesla in order to be more environmentally friendly and mitigate emission impacts.To provide required amount of electricity an idea of using natural gas and steam turbines put forward, but in this case huge amount of water was needed for cooling. They figured out that 2.5 million barrels sea water per day was needed for achievement of this process which was equal to Houston\'s potable water supply every day.The biggest challenge they faced was that by using less water they had to kept marine life uninfluenced. After the involvement of marine researchers it becomes apparent that water at the depth of 2000 feet was so much colder that enabled to halve the consumption. However, another challenge came across that in this depth of water small marine creatures called as "Phronima" lives. Swimming of "Phronima" at a 1/2 per second gave an idea that pulling water from 2000 feet slowly enough by using multiple intake pipes allows marine creatures to stay out of harm. #Appomattox #Shell', '29'], ["Dear all, I proudly announce that I joined SOCAR OGCT this month as a Project Engineer. I'm currently working at Foreign Relations Department on different ongoing projects and so excited to learn and grow in this role as a specialist.I'd like to thank my parents, teachers, and friends for their support throughout this process. #project #engineering #SOCAR", '207'], ["15th July 2021 was the one of the unforgettable moments in my education life, because after 5 year dedication I finally got the Bachelor's degree of #Petroleumengineering on this day.The moment that you get your diploma on the stage, you realize that 5-year time period is not so long time indeed, and you become to miss your education life, friends and all of your university memories.It wasn‚Äôt possible without the constant support and guidance of my teachers, parents and friends. That's why, all the credit goes to them.And finally making public that I‚Äôve completed my higher education on Petroleum Engineering in Baku Higher Oil School, and looking forward to a new journeys and opportunities in front of me!#university #graduate2021 #petroleumengineering #BHOS #BSc", '119'], ['After past 2 months, I have successfully completed #AOGA20 summer internship program arranged by PioPetro of Marietta College and Society of Petroleum Engineers Egyptian Section. It was very great and beneficial opportunity offered to students all over the world during #COVID19 pandemic.I participated at more than 60 webinars of #AOGA20 intern program, and these webinars have covered different petroleum subjects (mainly #production engineering, #drilling engineering, #geology, #reservoir engineering and etc.), application of some software programs and also, general #oilandgas topics. Although this intern program was virtually managed, real field experiences was tried to be demonstrated by videos and photos from different areas. In the end, I want to thank Ahmed Algarhy, his hard-working team, moderators and also, all of engineers and professors taken part in for their efforts and helping me to sharpen my technical background. #SPE #petroleumegineering #oilandgasindustry', '37']]
